main event: A civilian sighting of an unidentified flying object (UFO) in the vicinity of Seattle and Renton, Washington on 13 March 1953. The object was observed for approximately 2-3 minutes through a telescope and was described as round, the size of a marble, light in color resembling steel, and exhibiting erratic behavior.
interesting points: The object was observed through a four-power telescope and was described as round, the size of a marble, and light in color resembling steel.
Two witnesses estimated the object's altitude at 20,000 feet and 35,000 feet, and reported that it made no sound and had no observed propulsion system.
One observer reported that the object was oscillating or bobbing up and down and was in view for approximately 2 to 3 minutes before being lost behind trees and houses.

The observed intensity of the sighting was rated about 1 on a 0 to 10 scale, and one observer noticed a bluish tinge and a balloon-like portion that became brighter and appeared slightly larger in size at one point.
The report was submitted by Major Gerald E. Tyler, a USAF intelligence officer, and was downgraded and declassified after a certain period as per the declassification policy.
sighted object: round object, the size of a marble, light in color resembling steel
